00017 bool ATPG::Do_ATPG(Wire *faultwire, Value faultval)
00018 {
00019     bool result;
00020     Implication* newImply;
00021 
00022 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00023     ATPG_DFILE << "ATPG called for faulty wire " <<  faultwire->id << endl;
00024     ATPG_DFILE << "Faulty value of the wire is " <<  faultval << endl;
00025 #endif
00026    
00027     // set the fault wire
00028     (circuit.faultWire) = faultwire; 
00029     
00030 
00031 
00032     // Push two implications for the faulty wire.
00033     // One backward to justify vbar on the line stuck
00034     // at v. One forward to propagate the stuck at v error.
00035     newImply= new Implication(circuit.faultWire,(faultval == D)?ONE:ZERO ,false); 
00036     (ImpliQueue).push(newImply); 
00037     newImply= new Implication(circuit.faultWire,faultval,true); 
00038     (ImpliQueue).push(newImply); 
00039 
00040 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00041     ATPG_DFILE << "Adding implication: " <<  (circuit.faultWire)->id  
00042         << "  value:  " <<  faultval <<  endl;
00043     ATPG_DFILE << "Calling D_Algo from DO_ATPG" << endl;
00044 #endif
00045 
00046 
00047     // Run the D Algorithm to find the test vectors.
00048     result = D_Algo();
00049 
00050     // Useless for now, as only D is implemented
00051     //Update_PI_For_9V();
00052 
00053 
00054     // Display results
00055 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00056     ATPG_DFILE << "Returning from D Algo for wire "  <<  faultwire->id << " with result " << result << endl;
00057    // circuit.Print_All_Wires();
00058 #endif
00059     
00060     CircuitGraphPrint();
00061     
00062    return result;
00063 
00064 }

00068 bool ATPG::Handle_Output_Coming_From_Noncontrol_Value(Implication* curImplication, Wire* curWire,Value impliedValue)
00069 {
00070     Gate* curGate = dynamic_cast<Gate*>(curWire->input);
00071     Value xorValue =  Do_Xor((Value)((~ControlValues[curGate->gtype])&0xf),(Value)InversionValues[curGate->gtype]);
00072     
00073  
00074 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00075     ATPG_DFILE << "Handling implication on wire " << curWire->id
00076           << " non-controlling value on gate inputs needed" << endl; 
00077 #endif
00078 
00079     // This function is reached only if the wire on 
00080     // which the implication is made has a gate 
00081     // input. i.e it is not a fanout branch and 
00082     // its value is cbar xor i
00083     
00084 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00085     ATPG_DFILE << "Value to be implied" << impliedValue << endl;
00086     ATPG_DFILE << "Value by Xor" <<  xorValue << endl;
00087     ATPG_DFILE << "Current value of the wire is " << curWire->value << endl;
00088     ATPG_DFILE << "Current gate's output evaluated is " << curGate->Evaluate();
00089 #endif
00090     assert(impliedValue ==  xorValue);
00091     assert(curGate);
00092 
00093 
00094     // Note the order of actions from here on is
00095     // important. 
00096 
00097 
00098     // ACTION 1:
00099     // The current value of the wire should be 
00100     // compatible with the value to be implied
00101     // else we need backtracking
00102 
00103     if ( (curWire != circuit.faultWire) && !Compatible(curWire->value,impliedValue))
00104     {
00105 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00106         ATPG_DFILE << "Implied value " << impliedValue << "  Current value  " << curWire->value << endl; 
00107         ATPG_DFILE << "Implied value contradicts the current value of the wire." << endl;
00108         ATPG_DFILE << "Wire in question is :" << curWire->id << endl;
00109         ATPG_DFILE << "Returning false , need to backtrack" << endl;
00110         ATPG_DFILE << endl;
00111 #endif
00112         return false;
00113     }
00114 
00115 
00116     // ACTION 2:
00117     // If the current value of the wire equals the 
00118     // implied value, the implication is popped here.
00119     // This means that either the gate is in Jfrontier already
00120     // or is already set by a forward impli
00121     if (curWire->value == impliedValue) 
00122     {
00123 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00124         ATPG_DFILE << "Implied value equals the current value of the wire." << endl;
00125         ATPG_DFILE << "Wire in question is :" << curWire->id << endl;
00126         ATPG_DFILE << "Popping off the implication" << endl;
00127         ATPG_DFILE << endl;
00128 #endif
00129         ImpliQueue.pop();
00130         return true;
00131     } 
00132    
00133    
00134     // ACTION 3:
00135     // The current gate will evaluate to the
00136     // implied value only if all input values
00137     // are cbar. Thus, no need to go backward.
00138     // Return true.
00139     
00140     // The second check is to ensure that 
00141     // we are still talking of the same implication
00142     // and not popping off something else, since
00143     // we might have popped in action 2
00144     if ((curGate->Evaluate() == impliedValue) && (curWire->id == ImpliQueue.front()->wire->id) )
00145     {
00146 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00147         ATPG_DFILE << "Implied value equals the value of the gate output." << endl;
00148         ATPG_DFILE << "Gate in question is :" << curGate->id << endl;
00149         ATPG_DFILE << "Popping off the implication" << endl;
00150         ATPG_DFILE << endl;
00151 #endif
00152 
00153         // Pop off the implication anyways
00154         // Set the value only if its not
00155         // the faulty wire
00156         if ( curWire != (circuit.faultWire) )
00157             Change_Value_And_Update_Log(curImplication);
00158         ImpliQueue.pop();
00159         
00160         return true;
00161     } 
00162 
00163 
00164 
00165     // ACTION 4: 
00166     // At this point, the gate can evaluate to either 
00167     // unknown or to c xor i, the latter being the case
00168     // where backtracking is needed.Check which of these
00169     // cases applies.
00170 
00171     switch (curGate->Evaluate())
00172     {   
00173         case U:
00174             {
00175                 list<Wire*>::iterator iter = (curGate->inputs).begin();
00176                 for (;iter != (curGate->inputs).end();iter++)
00177                 {
00178                     // All inputs should be cbar
00179                     Implication* newImply;
00180                     Value newVal = (Value)((~(ControlValues[curGate->gtype])) & 0xf);
00181                     newImply= new Implication(*iter,newVal,false); 
00182 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00183                     ATPG_DFILE << " Adding implication :  " << (*iter)->id << " Value: " <<  newVal << endl;
00184 #endif
00185                     ImpliQueue.push(newImply); 
00186                 }
00187 
00188                 // If it is the faulty wire, don't set the value
00189                 if ( curWire != (circuit.faultWire) )
00190                 {
00191 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00192                     ATPG_DFILE << " New intention:  " <<  curImplication->wire->id << "  " <<  curImplication->value << endl; 
00193 #endif
00194                     Change_Value_And_Update_Log(curImplication);
00195                 }
00196                 ImpliQueue.pop();
00197                 return true;
00198 
00199             }
00200 
00201 
00202         default:
00203             // Some input has value c
00204             {
00205 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00206                 ATPG_DFILE << "Evaluate of " << curGate->id << " gives :" << curGate->Evaluate() << endl;
00207                 ATPG_DFILE << "Evaluation not compatible with implied value: " << impliedValue << endl;
00208                 ATPG_DFILE << "Returning false" << endl;
00209                 ATPG_DFILE <<  endl;
00210 #endif
00211                 return false;
00212             }
00213     }
00214 
00215 }

00218 
00219 bool ATPG::Handle_Output_Coming_From_Control_Value(Implication* curImplication, Wire* curWire,Value impliedValue)
00220 {
00221 
00222     Gate* curGate = dynamic_cast<Gate*>(curWire->input);
00223     Value xorValue =  Do_Xor((Value)((ControlValues[curGate->gtype])&0xf),(Value)InversionValues[curGate->gtype]);
00224     
00225  
00226 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00227     ATPG_DFILE << "Handling implication on wire " << curWire->id
00228                << " controlling value on gate inputs needed" << endl; 
00229     ATPG_DFILE << "Value to be implied" << impliedValue << endl;
00230     ATPG_DFILE << "Value by Xor" <<  xorValue << endl;
00231     ATPG_DFILE << "Current value of the wire is " << curWire->value << endl;
00232     ATPG_DFILE << "Current gate's output evaluated is " << curGate->Evaluate();
00233 #endif
00234 
00235 
00236     // Assumption: 
00237     // The implication is on a wire
00238     // that isn't a PI or a fanout branch
00239     // They are taken care of separately and 
00240     // not in this function
00241     
00242     int inputUCount = 0;
00243     list<Wire*>::iterator iter;
00244     
00245     assert(impliedValue == xorValue);
00246 
00247     // Note the order of actions from here on is
00248     // important. 
00249 
00250 
00251     // ACTION 1:
00252     // The current value of the wire should be 
00253     // compatible with the value to be implied
00254     // else we need backtracking
00255 
00256     if ( (curWire != circuit.faultWire) &&   !Compatible(curWire->value,impliedValue))
00257     {
00258 
00259 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00260         ATPG_DFILE << "Implied value " << impliedValue << "  Current value  " << curWire->value << endl; 
00261         ATPG_DFILE << "Implied value contradicts the current value of the wire." << endl;
00262         ATPG_DFILE << "Wire in question is :" << curWire->id << endl;
00263         ATPG_DFILE << "Returning false , need to backtrack" << endl;
00264         ATPG_DFILE << endl;
00265 #endif
00266         return false;
00267     }
00268 
00269     // ACTION 2:
00270     // If the current value of the wire equals the 
00271     // implied value, the implication is popped here.
00272     // This means that either the gate is in Jfrontier already
00273     // or is already set by a forward impli
00274     if (curWire->value == impliedValue) 
00275     {
00276 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00277         ATPG_DFILE << "Implied value equals the current value of the wire." << endl;
00278         ATPG_DFILE << "Wire in question is :" << curWire->id << endl;
00279         ATPG_DFILE << "Popping off the implication" << endl;
00280         ATPG_DFILE << endl;
00281 #endif
00282         ImpliQueue.pop();
00283         return true;
00284     } 
00285 
00286 
00287     // ACTION 3:
00288     // The current gate will evaluate to the
00289     // implied value only if some input value
00290     // are c. Thus, no need to go backward.
00291     // Return true.
00292     
00293     if ((curGate->Evaluate() == impliedValue) && (curWire->id == ImpliQueue.front()->wire->id) )
00294     {
00295         // if it is the faulty wire, don't set the value
00296         if (curWire != (circuit.faultWire))
00297             Change_Value_And_Update_Log(curImplication);
00298         ImpliQueue.pop();
00299         return true;
00300     } 
00301 
00302     // ACTION 4:
00303     // If we came here, no input has value
00304     // C. Therefore, the following code sets 
00305     // some input to C.
00306     // Count the number of unknown inputs. 
00307     // Further action depends on the count.
00308     // 0  : Something wrong. We need atleast
00309     // one U to set it to c.
00310     // 1  :  Imply on that being C since
00311     // thats the only way out.
00312     // >1 : Add the gate to J frontier.
00313     
00314     
00315     iter = (curGate->inputs).begin();
00316     for (;iter != (curGate->inputs).end();iter++)
00317     {
00318         if  ( (*iter)->value  == U) inputUCount++;
00319     }
00320 
00321 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00322     ATPG_DFILE << "Input UCount is " << inputUCount << " for gate " << curGate->id << endl;
00323 #endif
00324 
00325     if (inputUCount>1) 
00326     {
00327         // if it is the faulty wire, don't set the value
00328         
00329         if ( curWire != (circuit.faultWire) )
00330             Change_Value_And_Update_Log(curImplication);
00331         
00332 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00333         ATPG_DFILE << "Adding to J Frontier:  " << (*iter)->id << endl;
00334 #endif
00335         Add_To_JFrontier(curWire,impliedValue);
00336         ImpliQueue.pop();
00337         return true;
00338     }
00339 
00340     if (inputUCount == 1)
00341     {
00342 
00343         // Iterate again to find out which wire
00344         // has unknown value and imply C on it.
00345 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00346         ATPG_DFILE << "Hunting for the only input wire with value U" << endl; 
00347 #endif
00348 
00349         for (iter = (curGate->inputs).begin();iter != (curGate->inputs).end();iter++)
00350         {
00351 
00352             if (Compatible((*iter)->value,U))
00353             {
00354 
00355                 Value newVal = (ControlValues[curGate->gtype]);
00356                 // false indicates backward direction
00357                 Implication* newImply= new Implication(*iter,newVal,false);
00358 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00359                 ATPG_DFILE << (*iter)->id << "is the sole input wire with Value U" << endl;  
00360                 ATPG_DFILE << "Adding implication on that wire with  value:  " <<  newVal << endl;
00361 #endif
00362                 ImpliQueue.push(newImply); 
00363 
00364             }
00365         }
00366 
00367         ImpliQueue.pop();
00368         
00369         // If it is the faulty wire, don't set the value
00370         if ( curWire != (circuit.faultWire) )
00371         {     
00372             cout<<  curImplication->wire->id << "  " <<  curImplication->value << endl; 
00373             Change_Value_And_Update_Log(curImplication);
00374         }    
00375         return true;
00376     }
00377 }

00379 
00380 
00381 bool ATPG::Compatible(Value oldval,Value newval)
00382 {
00383     if (oldval == newval) return true;
00384 
00385     switch (oldval)
00386     {
00387         case U:
00388             return true;
00389         case UBYONE:
00390             if (newval == UBYONE || newval == DBAR || newval == ONE)
00391             return true;
00392             else 
00393             return false;    
00394 
00395         case UBYZERO:
00396             if (newval == UBYZERO || newval == D || newval == ZERO)
00397             return true;
00398             else 
00399             return false;    
00400 
00401       case ZEROBYU:
00402             if (newval == ZERO || newval == DBAR || newval == ZEROBYU)
00403             return true;
00404             else 
00405             return false;    
00406 
00407 
00408       case ONEBYU:
00409             if (newval == ONE || newval == D || newval == ONEBYU)
00410             return true;
00411             else 
00412             return false;    
00413     }
00414     return false;
00415 }

00419 bool ATPG::Add_To_JFrontier(Wire *wire,Value value)
00420 {
00421     circuit.TempJFrontier.push_back(WireValuePair(wire,value));
00422 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00423     ATPG_DFILE  << "Added a gate with output wire " <<  wire->id << " to JFrontier." << endl;
00424     ATPG_DFILE <<  "JFrontier is now  " << endl; 
00425     PRINTJFRONTIER;
00426     ATPG_DFILE << endl << endl;
00427 #endif
00428     return true;
00429 }

00445 
00446 bool ATPG::Remove_From_D(Wire *wire)
00447 {
00448     bool result=false;
00449     list<WireValuePair>::iterator iter = circuit.DFrontier.begin();
00450 
00451     while (iter != circuit.DFrontier.end())
00452     {
00453         if ( (iter->iwire) == wire )
00454         {
00455             iter = circuit.DFrontier.erase(iter);
00456             result = true;
00457 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00458             ATPG_DFILE  << "Removed a gate with output wire " <<  wire->id << " from DFrontier." << endl;
00459             ATPG_DFILE <<  "DFrontier is now  " << endl; 
00460             PRINTDFRONTIER;
00461 #endif
00462             continue;   // we can return from function
00463         }
00464         iter ++;
00465     }
00466     if (!result) ATPG_DFILE << "Not found in DFrontier : gate with output wire " <<  wire->id << " from DFrontier." << endl;
00467 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00468     ATPG_DFILE << endl << endl;
00469 #endif
00470     return result;
00471 }

00490 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE

00492     ATPG_DFILE <<  "JFrontier is now  " << endl;

00500 
00501 bool ATPG::Imply_And_Check()
00502 {
00503 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00504     ATPG_DFILE << "Imply_And_Check called" << endl;
00505 #endif
00506     assert(Logs.empty());
00507     
00508     while (!ImpliQueue.empty())
00509     {
00510 
00511         //  Step 1: Get Details of current implication 
00512         Implication*  curImplication = (ImpliQueue).front();
00513         Wire* curWire = curImplication->wire;
00514         Value curValue = curImplication->value;
00515 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00516         ATPG_DFILE <<  "New implication from the queue:  " << (curWire->id) <<  " value:   "<< (curValue) ;
00517 #endif
00518         if (curImplication->direction == 0)  ATPG_DFILE <<   "  backwards" << endl;
00519         else  ATPG_DFILE << "  forward" << endl;
00520             
00521 
00522         //  Resolving backward implication
00523         if (curImplication->direction == false) 
00524         {
00525             if (Resolve_Backward_Implication(curImplication,curWire,curValue) == false)
00526             {
00527 
00528 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00529                 ATPG_DFILE << "Backward implication not resolved " ;
00530                 ATPG_DFILE << ": Returning false" << endl << endl;
00531 #endif
00532                 goto fail;
00533             }
00534                 else continue;
00535 
00536         }
00537 
00538 
00539         //  Resolving forward implication
00540         else
00541         {
00542             if (Resolve_Forward_Implication(curImplication,curWire,curValue) == false)
00543          {
00544 
00545 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00546              ATPG_DFILE << "Forward implication not resolved " ;
00547              ATPG_DFILE << ": Returning false" << endl << endl;
00548 #endif
00549              goto fail;
00550 
00551          }
00552                 else continue;
00553 
00554         }
00555     }
00556 
00557     //Make_Assignments();       // Deprecated
00558     Clean_Logs();       // Clears the log
00559     // Merge the temporary frontiers with the global ones.
00560     Merge_Frontiers();
00561 
00562 
00563     return true;
00564 
00565 fail:
00566     Failure();
00567     return false;
00568 }
00569 
00570 
00571 
00572 void ATPG::Merge_Frontiers()
00573 {
00574     list<WireValuePair>::iterator iter= circuit.TempJFrontier.begin();
00575     for (; iter != circuit.TempJFrontier.end();iter++)
00576         circuit.JFrontier.push_front(*iter);
00577     for (iter= circuit.TempDFrontier.begin(); iter != circuit.TempDFrontier.end();iter++)
00578         circuit.DFrontier.push_front(*iter);
00579 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00580     ATPG_DFILE << "Merged the temp.frontiers with global ones" << endl;
00581 #endif
00582 
00583     circuit.TempJFrontier.clear();
00584     circuit.TempDFrontier.clear();
00585 
00586 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00587     ATPG_DFILE << "Cleared the temp.frontiers" << endl;
00588 #endif
00589 
00590     return;
00591 }

00609 
00610 void ATPG::Clean_Logs()
00611 {
00612     assert(ImpliQueue.empty());
00613     list<Implication*>::iterator iter= Logs.begin();
00614     for (; iter!=Logs.end();iter++)
00615     {
00616             // Old value is on the RHS
00617             (*iter)->wire->modified = false;
00618     }
00619     // Don't remove the logs because they might be used by Jfrontier.
00620     // DfrontierWork clears the logs in the start.
00621 //    Logs.clear();
00622     return;
00623 }
00624 
00625 
00626 void ATPG::Failure()
00627 {
00628 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00629     ATPG_DFILE << "Imply_And_Check failed. NEED TO BACKTRACK" << endl << endl;
00630     ATPG_DFILE << "Using the logs to reverse all decisions/assignments" << endl;
00631 #endif
00632     list<Implication*>::iterator iter= Logs.begin();
00633     for (; iter!=Logs.end();iter++)
00634     {
00635 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00636         ATPG_DFILE << "Reverting value of wire" << (*iter)->wire->id << " current val:" << (*iter)->wire->value << " reverting to " << (*iter)->value << endl; 
00637 #endif
00638             // Old value is on the RHS
00639             (*iter)->wire->value = (*iter)->value;
00640             // reset the modified flag anyways
00641             (*iter)->wire->modified = false;
00642     }
00643     Logs.clear();
00644     
00645     // remove all the implications thought of
00646     while (!ImpliQueue.empty())
00647             ImpliQueue.pop();
00648     circuit.TempJFrontier.clear();
00649     circuit.TempDFrontier.clear();
00650 
00651 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00652     ATPG_DFILE << "Cleared the temp.frontiers" << endl;
00653 #endif
00654 }

00656 
00657 bool ATPG::D_Algo()
00658 { 
00659      // Ensure all implications are made and they 
00660      // are consistent
00661     if (Imply_And_Check() == false) 
00662     {
00663 
00664 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00665         ATPG_DFILE << " Imply_And_Check returned false. Returning false from D_Algo " << endl;
00666 #endif
00667         return false;
00668     }
00669    
00670 
00671     // The declarations needed later are made here,
00672     // even though we are not sure they will be 
00673     // needed because the compiler
00674     // doesn't like declarations in the middle of goto
00675     // jumps
00676     WireValuePair DFront = (circuit.DFrontier).front();
00677     WireValuePair *checkIter = &DFront;
00678     list<WireValuePair>::iterator checkIterator;
00679     map<string,Wire*>::iterator iter = (circuit.PriOutputs).begin();
00680   
00681 
00682     // Iterate through list of POs to see if any of them has 
00683     // D or DBAR. If so, return true.   
00684     for (; iter!=(circuit.PriOutputs).end();iter++)
00685     {
00686         // D_Algo just takes care of returning true.
00687         // The input vector should then be recorded 
00688         // by the Do_ATPG function
00689         if (iter->second->value == D ||  iter->second->value == DBAR )
00690             goto JFrontierWork;
00691     }
00692 
00693 DFrontierWork:
00694     // Error is not at PO. Algo should execute
00695     //
00696     // We don't need to save logs. Therefore let us clear the logs;
00697     Logs.clear();
00698     
00699 
00700     // No means of propagating the error ahead
00701     if (circuit.DFrontier.empty()) 
00702     {
00703 
00704 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00705         ATPG_DFILE  << "Found the D Frontier empty and hence cant propagate fault." << endl;
00706         ATPG_DFILE  <<  "Returning false" << endl << endl ;
00707 #endif
00708         return false;
00709     }
00710 
00711     PRINTDFRONTIER;
00712     
00713     
00714     // for (;checkIter !=(circuit.DFrontier).end();checkIter++)
00715     // Remember a stack and understand how this works
00716     // Add_to_D_frontier function always pushes into 
00717     // this stack. We will pop off the top one from the D frontier
00718     // set the implications.
00719     // On calling D again, few more gates will be added on the top of the D frontier.
00720     
00721     while ( !circuit.DFrontier.empty() )
00722     {
00723          
00724 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00725         ATPG_DFILE << "Current size of D = " << circuit.DFrontier.size() 
00726                    << " About to take " << checkIter->iwire->id << "  from D" << endl;
00727 #endif
00728      
00729         // Take the first element off the D frontier
00730         DFront = (circuit.DFrontier).front();
00731         checkIter = &DFront;
00732         (circuit.DFrontier).pop_front();
00733         
00734         
00735         /*Selecting a gate from the DFrontier*/
00736         Gate* curGate=dynamic_cast<Gate*>(checkIter->iwire->input);
00737         Value cval = ControlValues[curGate->gtype];
00738         list<Wire*>::iterator inputIter = (curGate->inputs).begin();
00739 
00740         // Handle Xor here
00741         if (curGate->gtype == XOR)
00742         {
00743 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00744             ATPG_DFILE << "Handling Xor in D frontier" << endl;
00745 #endif
00746 
00747             // Just lazy to handle mutiple input xor...For now, only 2 input xor
00748             if ((curGate->inputs).size() != 2)
00749                 assert(false);
00750 
00751             if ((*inputIter)->value != U)
00752                 inputIter++;
00753 
00754             if ((*inputIter)->value != U)
00755             {
00756 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00757                 ATPG_DFILE << __LINE__ << "  Something wrong ! this gate should not be in D frontier" << endl;
00758 #endif
00759                 goto DoneXor;
00760             }
00761 
00762             // We got two bullets and if we can't shoot the balloon, we lose.
00763             
00764             // First attempt - Imply 0 on the unknown wire and observe
00765             // Second attempt - Imply 1 on the unknown wire and observe
00766 
00767             for (int i=0;i<2; i++)
00768             {
00769                 // Pushing backward impli
00770                 Implication* newImply= new Implication(*inputIter,(Value)(i*0xf),false); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/ // remember to push 0 or 15
00771 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00772                 ATPG_DFILE << "Adding backward implication: " << (*inputIter)->id << " value "<< i*0xf << endl; 
00773 #endif
00774                 (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
00775 
00776                 // Pushing forward impli
00777                 newImply= new Implication(*inputIter,(Value)(i*0xf),true); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/
00778 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00779                 ATPG_DFILE << "Adding forward implication: " << (*inputIter)->id << " value "<< i*0xf << endl;
00780 #endif
00781                 (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
00782 
00783                 // If the D-Drive succeeded through this gate, well and good, return true
00784                 // Else we have another trial - i e try ONE on the unknown wire 
00785                 if (D_Algo() == true) return true;
00786             }
00787 
00788 DoneXor:
00789             continue;
00790         }
00791 
00792 
00793 
00794         for (;inputIter != (curGate->inputs).end();inputIter++)
00795         {
00796             if ((*inputIter)->value == U)
00797             {
00798 
00799                 Implication* newImply= new Implication(*inputIter,(Value)((~cval)&0xf),false); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/
00800 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00801                 ATPG_DFILE << "Adding backward implication: " << (*inputIter)->id
00802                     <<  ~(cval) << endl; 
00803 #endif
00804                 (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
00805                 newImply= new Implication(*inputIter,(Value)((~cval)&0xf),true); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/
00806 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00807                 ATPG_DFILE << "Adding forward implication: " << (*inputIter)->id
00808                     <<  ~(cval) << endl; 
00809 #endif
00810                 (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
00811             }         
00812             else
00813                 ;
00814 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00815               ATPG_DFILE << "Wire: " << (*inputIter)->id << "value: " <<  (*inputIter)->value <<endl; 
00816 #endif
00817 
00818 
00819         }
00820 
00821       /* If the D-Drive succeeded through this gate, well and good, return true
00822        * Else we try the next gate in the D-frontier
00823        */
00824      if (D_Algo() == true) return true;
00825     }
00826 
00827     // We have tried all the gates, but couldn't propagate the error ( if we come here, it means that we couldn't propagate throught any gate in D frontier )
00828     // Hence we return false;
00829     return false;
00830 
00831 // For J frontier, we need not pop off the element.
00832 // When we set the implications, Imply_And_Check will remove the gate
00833 // from the D frontier. This is the only difference between DFrontierWork and JFrontierWork
00834 //
00835 JFrontierWork:
00836     list<Implication *>CurLogs;
00837     CurLogs = Logs;
00838     Logs.clear();
00839     if (circuit.JFrontier.empty()) return true;
00840     checkIterator = (circuit.JFrontier).begin();
00841 
00842     PRINTJFRONTIER;
00843     
00844     //  Selecting a gate from the JFrontier
00845     //  A note about the J Frontier:
00846     //  We add a gate to the J Frontier if:
00847     //  1. Its output is c (control val) xor i
00848     //  2. more than input has value x
00849     //  3. none of the inputs which currently have
00850     //  known values have value c
00851        Gate* curGate=dynamic_cast<Gate*>(checkIterator->iwire->input);
00852        Value cval = ControlValues[curGate->gtype];
00853         
00854 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00855       ATPG_DFILE <<__FILE__<<__LINE__ << "    " << __LINE__ << "    " ;
00856       ATPG_DFILE <<__FILE__<<__LINE__ << "    " << "Selected gate: " << curGate->id 
00857         << "from the J Frontier" << endl;
00858       ATPG_DFILE <<__FILE__<<__LINE__ << "    " << "Control value is: " << cval << endl;
00859       ATPG_DFILE <<__FILE__<<__LINE__ << "    " << endl <<  endl;
00860 
00861 #endif
00862 
00863       /*Select an input with Value U*/
00864       list<Wire*>::iterator inputIter = (curGate->inputs).begin();
00865 
00866       // Handle Xor here
00867       if (curGate->gtype == XOR)
00868       {
00869 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00870           ATPG_DFILE << "Handling Xor in J frontier" << endl;
00871 #endif
00872 
00873           // Just lazy to handle mutiple input xor...For now, only 2 input xor
00874           if ((curGate->inputs).size() != 2)
00875               assert(false);
00876 
00877           // iterator to the second input wire
00878           list<Wire*>::iterator inputIter2 = ++((curGate->inputs).begin());
00879 
00880 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00881           ATPG_DFILE << "in1 = " << ((*inputIter)->value) << " in2 = " << ((*inputIter2)->value) << " want to justify value=" << checkIterator->value << endl;
00882 #endif
00883 
00884           // Case I - both the inputs are unknown
00885           if  ( ((*inputIter)->value == U) && ((*inputIter2)->value == U) )
00886           {
00887               // Here we try the two solutions to satisfy the
00888               // output value
00889 
00890               Value in1,in2;
00891 
00892               // I hope that the implied value is either 0 or 1 and
00893               // not other values.
00894               if (checkIterator->value == ONE)
00895               {
00896                   in1 = ONE; in2 = ZERO;
00897               }
00898               else 
00899                   in1 = in2 = ZERO;
00900 
00901               // trying the two ways
00902               for (int i=0;i<2; i++)
00903               {
00904                   // Pushing backward impli on in1
00905                   Implication* newImply= new Implication(*inputIter,in1,false); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/
00906 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00907                   ATPG_DFILE << "Adding backward implication: " << (*inputIter)->id << " value "<< i << endl; 
00908 #endif
00909                   (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
00910 
00911                   // Pushing forward impli on in1
00912                   newImply= new Implication(*inputIter,in1,true); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/
00913 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00914                   ATPG_DFILE << "Adding forward implication: " << (*inputIter)->id << " value "<< i << endl;
00915 #endif
00916                   (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
00917 
00918                   // Pushing backward impli on in2
00919                   newImply= new Implication(*inputIter2,in2,false); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/
00920 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00921                   ATPG_DFILE << "Adding backward implication: " << (*inputIter2)->id << " value "<< i << endl; 
00922 #endif
00923                   (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
00924 
00925                   // Pushing forward impli on in2
00926                   newImply= new Implication(*inputIter2,in2,true); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/
00927 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00928                   ATPG_DFILE << "Adding forward implication: " << (*inputIter2)->id << " value "<< i << endl;
00929 #endif
00930                   (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
00931 
00932                   // If the D-Drive succeeded through this gate, well and good, return true
00933                   // Else we have another trial - i e try ONE on the unknown wire 
00934                   if (D_Algo() == true) return true;
00935 
00936                   // Compliment the original values
00937                   in1 =(Value) ((~(int)in1)&0xf);
00938                   in2 =(Value) ((~(int)in2)&0xf);
00939               }
00940           }
00941           // Case II - Only one wire is unknown
00942           else 
00943           {
00944               // Here inputIter should point to the first wire and inputIter2 to second
00945               // Make sure iter2 points to the wire with known value and iter to unknown
00946               if ((*inputIter2)->value == U)
00947               {
00948                   inputIter2--;
00949                   inputIter++;
00950               }
00951               
00952               // TODO:put some error checks
00953 
00954               // Error check 1: if we have d or dbar on any inputs, we cannot justify a full value(0 or 1) on the output of an xor
00955 #define       ISDORDBAR(X)  ((X == D) || (X == DBAR))
00956               if (ISDORDBAR((*inputIter)->value) || ISDORDBAR((*inputIter2)->value))
00957                   goto JFrontierFail;
00958                   //return false;
00959 
00960 #define       V_XOR(x,y)     (Value)((((int)(x) & (~(int)(y))) | ( (~(int)(x)) & (int)(y)))&0xf)
00961 
00962               Value val = V_XOR( checkIterator->value, (*inputIter2)->value);
00963 
00964               // Pushing backward impli
00965               Implication* newImply= new Implication(*inputIter,val,false); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/
00966 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00967               ATPG_DFILE << "Adding backward implication: " << (*inputIter)->id << " value "<< val << endl; 
00968 #endif
00969               (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
00970 
00971               // Pushing forward impli
00972               newImply= new Implication(*inputIter,val,true); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/
00973 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00974               ATPG_DFILE << "Adding forward implication: " << (*inputIter)->id << " value "<< val << endl;
00975 #endif
00976               (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
00977 
00978               // If the D-Drive succeeded through this gate, well and good, return true
00979               // Else fail 
00980               if (D_Algo() == true) return true;
00981           }
00982 
00983           goto JFrontierFail;
00984       }
00985 
00986       for (;inputIter != (curGate->inputs).end();inputIter++)
00987       {
00988           if (Compatible((*inputIter)->value,cval))
00989           {
00990               // All implications backward
00991               Implication* newImply= new Implication(*inputIter,(Value)(cval),false); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/
00992 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
00993               ATPG_DFILE <<__FILE__<<__LINE__ << "    " << "+++++++++++++++++++++ Implying CVal: " << cval <<   " on input: " <<  (*inputIter)->id << endl;
00994 #endif
00995               (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
00996               
00997               newImply= new Implication(*inputIter,(Value)(cval),true); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/
00998               (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
00999               if (D_Algo() == true) return true;
01000               else 
01001                   // Implying c on this particular input didn't work
01002                   // so imply cbar 
01003               {
01004 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01005                   ATPG_DFILE <<__FILE__<<__LINE__ << "    " << "+++++++++++++++++++++ Implying ~CVal: " <<  ((~cval)&0xf) <<   " on input: " <<  (*inputIter)->id << endl;
01006 #endif
01007            
01008                   newImply= new Implication(*inputIter,(Value)((~cval)&0xf),false); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/
01009                   (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
01010 
01011                   newImply= new Implication(*inputIter,(Value)((~cval)&0xf),true); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/
01012                   (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
01013                   //if (D_Algo() == true) return true;
01014 
01015               }
01016           }         
01017       }
01018 JFrontierFail:
01019       // before we fail, we should undo the values we set
01020       Logs = CurLogs;
01021       Failure();
01022       return false;
01023 }
01024 
01025 
01026 
01027 void ATPG::Update_PI_For_9V()
01028 {
01029     map<string,Wire*> ::iterator iter =  (circuit.PriInputs).begin();
01030     for (;iter != (circuit.PriInputs).end(); iter++)
01031     {   
01032         if ( ( (iter->second)->value == ZEROBYU )  ||  ( (iter->second)->value == UBYZERO ))
01033             (iter->second)->value  = ZERO;
01034         if (( (iter->second)->value == UBYONE )  ||  ( (iter->second)->value == ONEBYU ) )
01035             (iter->second)->value  = ONE;
01036     }
01037 }

01040 
01041 
01042 
01043 
01044 bool ATPG::Resolve_Forward_Implication(Implication* curImplication,Wire* curWire, Value impliedValue)
01045 {
01046    
01047  
01048 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01049     ATPG_DFILE << "Handling forward implication on wire " << curWire->id << endl;
01050 #endif
01051     assert(curImplication->direction == true);
01052 
01053     // if the an implication comes on a faulty wire, take care of it properly
01054     // bad way of dealing ( vvv ) Better way is to change the implication value to the 
01055     // appropriate one.
01056     if (curWire == circuit.faultWire) 
01057     {
01058         if (curWire->value != U)
01059         {
01060         ImpliQueue.pop();
01061             switch (impliedValue)
01062             {
01063                 case ZERO:
01064                 case DBAR:
01065                     return (curWire->value == DBAR)?true:false;
01066                     break;
01067 
01068                 case ONE:
01069                 case D:
01070                     return (curWire->value == D)?true:false;
01071                     break;
01072 
01073                 default:
01074                     return false;
01075             }
01076         }
01077     }
01078     // Check if the value of the wire is already set
01079     // And if it is the right value or not
01080     else if (!Compatible(curWire->value,impliedValue))
01081     {
01082 
01083 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01084         ATPG_DFILE << "Implied value " << impliedValue << "  Current value  " << curWire->value << endl; 
01085         ATPG_DFILE << "Implied value contradicts the current value of the wire." << endl;
01086         ATPG_DFILE << "Wire in question is :" << curWire->id << endl;
01087         ATPG_DFILE << "Returning false , need to backtrack" << endl;
01088         ATPG_DFILE << endl;
01089 #endif
01090         return false;
01091     }
01092 
01093     // CASE 0:
01094     // If it is a PO, set the value to the wire 
01095     // and pop off the implication 
01096     if ((curWire->outputs).empty())
01097     {
01098         Change_Value_And_Update_Log(curImplication);
01099         ImpliQueue.pop();
01100 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01101         ATPG_DFILE << "Success, po reached and po value set to:" << impliedValue << endl;
01102 #endif
01103         return true;
01104     }
01105 
01106 
01107     Element *curEle = *((curWire->outputs).begin());
01108 
01109     // CASE 1: If there is a stemout, just
01110     // do the needful and return.
01111     
01112     if ( curEle->type ==  WIRE )
01113         return Handle_Forward_Implication_On_Stem(curImplication,curWire,impliedValue);
01114 
01115     // Case 2:  The wire has only one output
01116     // and it is a gate.
01117 
01118     Gate *curGate = dynamic_cast<Gate*>(curEle);
01119     assert(curGate);
01120     
01121     Value gateOldOutput = curGate->output->value;
01122     Value wireOldValue = curWire->value;
01123 
01124     // set the value for the wire, ie impliedValue to wire->value
01125 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01126     ATPG_DFILE << "Setting the value of the wire " << curImplication->wire->id  
01127                << " to the implied value " <<  curImplication->value << endl; 
01128 #endif
01129     Change_Value_And_Update_Log(curImplication);
01130         
01131 
01132     // Now that the value of the wire implied on is set, evaluate the 
01133     // gate again.
01134     Value gateNewOutput = curGate->Evaluate();
01135 
01136 
01137 
01138     // This is *some* logic. (The use of the || instead of just checking
01139     // for the first condition)
01140     // TODO: @Kashyap: Please put explanatory comments :-P
01141 
01142 
01143     if ((curGate->output != circuit.faultWire) && !(Compatible(gateOldOutput,gateNewOutput)|| Compatible(gateNewOutput,gateOldOutput)))
01144     {
01145         // revert back !
01146 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01147         ATPG_DFILE << "Gate's old output, without setting the value of the wire was" << gateOldOutput << endl;
01148         ATPG_DFILE << "Gate's new output, after setting the value of the wire is" << gateNewOutput << endl;
01149         ATPG_DFILE << "Not compatible,Returning false" << endl;
01150 #endif
01151         return false;
01152     }
01153     
01154 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01155     ATPG_DFILE << "GateOldOutput = " << gateOldOutput << " NewOutput = " << gateNewOutput << endl;
01156 #endif
01157     
01158     
01159     
01160     // Case - gate's old output is unknown or not completely known
01161     if ( isNotKnown(gateOldOutput) ) 
01162     {
01163         // Case I - gate old value == new value = U / partially known
01164         if (isNotKnown(gateNewOutput))
01165         {
01166             // Add to the D frontier, only if there is error on the input line
01167             if ( (impliedValue == D) || (impliedValue == DBAR))
01168             {
01169                 // Add the gate to D frontier
01170 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01171                  ATPG_DFILE << "Adding gate to D frontier: " << curGate->id  
01172                             << " with value: "  << gateNewOutput << endl;
01173 #endif
01174                  //bug: Add_To_DFrontier(curGate->output, gateNewOutput);
01175                  Add_To_DFrontier(curGate->output, U);
01176             }
01177 
01178             // Set the value of the value (useful in 9V)
01179             // curGate->output->value = gateNewOutput;
01180             // pop off the implication and proceed !
01181             ImpliQueue.pop();
01182             return true;
01183         }
01184 
01185         // Now just propagate the value further
01186         // But before that check if the gate is in D frontier 
01187         // and remove the gate from it. Because it is resolved now
01188 
01189         if (Remove_From_D(curGate->output))
01190              ATPG_DFILE << "The gate is indeed in D and has been removed" << curGate->id << endl;
01191         else 
01192             ATPG_DFILE << "The gate is not there in D frontier. report from " << __LINE__ << endl;
01193                 
01194 
01195         // The last thing to do is to propagate the impli and
01196         // before that, popping off the current impli
01197 
01198         // pop off the current impli
01199         ImpliQueue.pop();
01200         Implication* newImply= new Implication(curGate->output,gateNewOutput,true); /*bool true = 0 = forward*/
01201 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01202         ATPG_DFILE << "Adding implication on wire " << curGate->output->id << "  Line: " << __LINE__ << "    " << endl;
01203 #endif
01204         ImpliQueue.push(newImply); 
01205 
01206         return true;
01207 
01208     }
01209 
01210     // This is the case where the gate ouput is previously known.
01211     // Reason: Due to some implication, which finally added this 
01212     // gate to J frontier  
01213     else 
01214     {
01215 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01216        ATPG_DFILE << "Removing from J frontier" << endl;
01217 #endif
01218         if ( gateNewOutput == U )
01219         {
01220             // pop off the current implication
01221             (ImpliQueue).pop();
01222             return true;
01223         }
01224 
01225         if (Remove_From_J(curGate->output))
01226             ATPG_DFILE << "The gate is indeed in J and has been removed  " << curGate->id << endl;
01227         else 
01228             ATPG_DFILE << "The gate is not there in J frontier. report from " << __LINE__  << endl;
01229 
01230         // The last thing to do is to propagate the impli and
01231         // before that, popping off the current impli
01232 
01233         // pop off the current impli
01234         ImpliQueue.pop();
01235 //        Implication* newImply= new Implication(curGate->output,gateNewOutput,true); /*bool true = 0 = forward*/
01236 //        cout<<__FILE__<<__LINE__ << "    " << "Adding implication :  " << curGate->id << ". Line: " << __LINE__ << "    " << endl;
01237 //        (ImpliQueue).push(newImply); 
01238         return true;
01239     }
01240 
01241 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01242     ATPG_DFILE<< "Returning false from end of function Resolve_Forward_Implication" << endl;
01243 #endif
01244     return false;
01245 
01246 }
01247 
01248 
01249 bool  ATPG::Handle_Forward_Implication_On_Stem(Implication* curImplication, Wire* curWire, Value impliedValue)
01250 {
01251 
01252     Implication* newImply; 
01253 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01254     ATPG_DFILE << "The forward implication is on a wire which is a stem" << endl;
01255 #endif
01256 
01257 
01258     // First set the value of the current wire 
01259     // ie.the stem
01260     Change_Value_And_Update_Log(curImplication);
01261 
01262     list<Element*>::iterator iter=(curWire->outputs).begin();
01263     for (;iter != (curWire->outputs).end(); iter++)
01264     {
01265         Wire *owire = dynamic_cast<Wire*>(*iter);
01266         assert(owire != NULL);
01267 
01268         newImply = new Implication(owire, curImplication->value,true); 
01269 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01270         ATPG_DFILE << "Adding new implication on the branch" << owire->id  << " of stem " << curWire->id << endl;
01271 #endif
01272         ImpliQueue.push(newImply); 
01273     }
01274 
01275 
01276     // Pop off the current implication and return
01277 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01278     ATPG_DFILE << "Popping off the implication on the stem " << endl;
01279 #endif
01280     assert(ImpliQueue.front()->wire->id  == curWire->id);
01281     ImpliQueue.pop();
01282     return true;
01283 }
01284 
01285 
01286 
01287 
01288 
01289 bool ATPG::Resolve_Backward_Implication(Implication* curImplication,Wire* curWire, Value impliedValue)
01290 {
01291 
01292     // if it is the faulty, check if the value is already set
01293     if (curWire == circuit.faultWire)
01294     {
01295         if (curWire->value != U)
01296         {
01297 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01298             ATPG_DFILE << "This is bad....Should never happen !" << endl;
01299 #endif
01300         assert(false);
01301         }
01302     }
01303     // First check if the curr value is compatable with current
01304     else if (!Compatible(curWire->value, curImplication->value)) 
01305         return false;
01306 
01307 
01308     // Check if the wire is a PI.
01309     // If yes just set the value and
01310     // we are done with the implication 
01311     if ((curWire->input) == NULL)
01312     {
01313         cout<< "Reached PI." << endl;
01314         ImpliQueue.pop();
01315         if (curWire != circuit.faultWire) 
01316             Change_Value_And_Update_Log(curImplication);
01317         return true;
01318     }
01319 
01320 
01321     // Handle two cases. Fanout and no fanout.
01322     // CASE 1: If there is a stemout, just
01323     // do the needful and return.
01324 
01325     if ((curWire->input)->type == WIRE)
01326     {
01327         // first check if the curr value is compatable with current
01328         if ( (curWire != circuit.faultWire) && 
01329                 (!Compatible(curWire->value, curImplication->value) 
01330                 ) )
01331             return false;
01332 
01333 
01334         // First set the value of the current wire
01335         if (curWire != circuit.faultWire )
01336             Change_Value_And_Update_Log(curImplication);
01337 
01338 
01339         Wire *stemWire = dynamic_cast<Wire*> (curWire->input);
01340 
01341 
01342         // Add a new implication for the stem - backward
01343         Implication* newImply = new Implication(stemWire, curImplication->value,false); 
01344         (ImpliQueue).push(newImply); 
01345 
01346         // Add implications for the remaining branches of the input
01347         list<Element*>::iterator iter=(stemWire->outputs).begin();
01348         for (; iter != (stemWire->outputs).end(); iter++)
01349         {
01350             Wire *owire = dynamic_cast<Wire *> (*iter);
01351 
01352             // If this assert fails == resolve branches failure
01353             assert(owire != NULL);
01354             if ( owire != curWire  && owire != circuit.faultWire)
01355             {
01356                 // Add forward implications for the remaining branches, other than the current one
01357                 newImply = new Implication(owire, curImplication->value,true);
01358 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01359                 ATPG_DFILE << "Adding forward implication: " <<  owire->id << endl;
01360 #endif
01361                 ImpliQueue.push(newImply); 
01362 
01363             }
01364         }
01365 
01366         // Pop off the current implication and return
01367         ImpliQueue.pop();
01368         return true;
01369     }
01370 
01371 
01372     // CASE 2:  Not fanout. So the wire is the output 
01373     // of a gate.
01374 
01375     Gate* curGate = dynamic_cast<Gate*>(curWire->input);
01376     Value xorValue =  Do_Xor(ControlValues[curGate->gtype],InversionValues[curGate->gtype]);
01377 
01378     assert(curGate);
01379 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01380     ATPG_DFILE << "Backward implication is on this gate's output: " << curGate->id << endl;
01381 #endif
01382 
01383     if ( impliedValue == xorValue)
01384     {
01385         return Handle_Output_Coming_From_Control_Value(curImplication,curWire,impliedValue);
01386     }
01387     else if  ( impliedValue == Do_Xor((Value)((~ControlValues[curGate->gtype])&0xf),InversionValues[curGate->gtype]))
01388 
01389     {
01390         return Handle_Output_Coming_From_Noncontrol_Value(curImplication,curWire,impliedValue);
01391     }
01392     else 
01393     {
01394 
01395         // Note: The xor for the gates which have no
01396         // controlling value will always return U
01397         // Hence, this piece of code will be used
01398         // for BUF  NOT and XOR gates.
01399 
01400         // NOT & BUF GATE are almost identical
01401         if ((curGate->gtype == NOT) || (curGate->gtype == BUF))
01402         {
01403 
01404             // First take care of the output wire, on this
01405             // implication has been made.
01406             if (curWire != circuit.faultWire)
01407             {
01408                 if ( !Compatible(curWire->value, curImplication->value) )
01409                     return false;
01410                 Change_Value_And_Update_Log(curImplication);
01411             }
01412 
01413 
01414             // Then take care of the gate inputs.
01415             Wire *iwire = *((curGate->inputs).begin());
01416             Value negValue =  (Value)((~impliedValue)&0xf);
01417 
01418             cout << "Added new wire to Implication queue" << iwire->id << " Value: " << negValue << endl;
01419             Implication* newImply= new Implication(iwire,(curGate->gtype == NOT)?negValue:impliedValue,false);
01420             ImpliQueue.push(newImply);
01421 
01422 
01423             ImpliQueue.pop();
01424             return true;
01425         }
01426         else if (curGate->gtype == XOR)
01427         {
01428 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01429             ATPG_DFILE << __FILE__ << __LINE__ << "Handling xor :)" << endl;
01430 #endif
01431 
01432             // Just lazy to handle mutiple input xor...For now, only 2 input xor
01433             if ((curGate->inputs).size() != 2)
01434                 assert(false);
01435 
01436             // iterators to the two wires
01437             list<Wire*>::iterator inputIter, inputIter2 = (curGate->inputs).begin();
01438             inputIter = inputIter2++;
01439 
01440             // first reflect the impli on the wire
01441             if (curWire != circuit.faultWire)
01442             {
01443                 if ( !Compatible(curWire->value, curImplication->value) )
01444                 {
01445 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01446                     ATPG_DFILE << __LINE__ << "cur value and implied values not compatable" << endl;
01447 #endif
01448                     return false;
01449                 }
01450                 Change_Value_And_Update_Log(curImplication);
01451             }
01452             
01453             // Case I - both the inputs are unknown. Then add the gate to J frontier
01454             if  ( ((*inputIter)->value == U) && ((*inputIter2)->value == U) )
01455             {
01456                 Add_To_JFrontier(curWire, curImplication->value);
01457                 ImpliQueue.pop();
01458                 return true;
01459             }
01460             // Case II - when both the values are known, then check for consistency
01461             // and return t/f accordingly
01462             else if  ( ((*inputIter)->value != U) && ((*inputIter2)->value != U) )
01463             {
01464                 // if the gate evaluates to different value than the implied one,
01465                 // report error
01466                 if ( !Compatible(curGate->Evaluate(), curImplication->value) )
01467                 {
01468 
01469 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01470                     ATPG_DFILE << "gate evaluates to different value" << endl;
01471 #endif
01472                     return false;
01473                 }
01474 
01475                 // else pop the impli and return true
01476                 ImpliQueue.pop();
01477                 return true;
01478             }
01479             // Case III - when one of the values is not known
01480             // Then add new implications to propagate backward
01481             else 
01482             {
01483                 // Here inputIter should point to the first wire and inputIter2 to second
01484                 // Make sure iter2 points to the wire with known value and iter to unknown
01485                 if ((*inputIter2)->value == U)
01486                 {
01487                     inputIter2--;
01488                     inputIter++;
01489                 }
01490 
01491                 // if the known input is not 0 or 1 (i.e D or Dbar), then the
01492                 // backward implication can never be satisfifed.
01493                 if (((*inputIter2)->value != ONE) && ((*inputIter2)->value != ZERO))
01494                 {
01495                     ImpliQueue.pop();    // not needed
01496                     ATPG_DFILE << "D/Dbar on one of the inputs" << endl;
01497                     return false;
01498                 }
01499 
01500 #define         V_XOR(x,y)     (Value)((((int)(x) & (~(int)(y))) | ( (~(int)(x)) & (int)(y)))&0xf)
01501 
01502                 Value val = V_XOR( curImplication->value, (*inputIter2)->value);
01503 
01504                 // pop off the current impli and push new ones
01505                 (ImpliQueue).pop();
01506 
01507                 // Pushing backward impli
01508                 Implication* newImply= new Implication(*inputIter,val,false); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/
01509 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01510                 ATPG_DFILE << "Adding backward implication: " << (*inputIter)->id << " value "<< val << endl; 
01511 #endif
01512                 (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
01513 
01514                 // Pushing forward impli
01515                 newImply= new Implication(*inputIter,val,true); /*bool false = 0 = backward*/
01516 #ifdef VERBOSE_MODE
01517                 ATPG_DFILE << "Adding forward implication: " << (*inputIter)->id << " value "<< val << endl;
01518 #endif
01519                 (ImpliQueue).push(newImply);
01520                 return true;
01521             }
01522 
01523         }
01524         else 
01525         { 
01526             cout << "Gate type is :" << curGate->gtype << endl;
01527             cout << "Value implied is " << impliedValue << endl;
01528             cout<<__FILE__<<__LINE__ << "    " <<"Something wrong"<< endl;
01529             assert(false);
01530         }
01531     }
01532 }

01534 
01535 
01536 Implication* Find_In_Logs_List(Wire* wire)
01537 {
01538     list<Implication*>:: iterator iter = Logs.begin();
01539     for (;iter!=Logs.end();iter++)
01540     {
01541          if (wire == (*iter)->wire) 
01542             return (*iter);
01543     }
01544     return NULL;
01545 }
01546 
01547 // TODO: Create a new class for log, which doesn't contain the bool direction
01548 bool Change_Value_And_Update_Log (Implication *curImpli)
01549 {
01550         // You have a intention, I make it true :) Enjoy !
01551         // But before I have to log it :P
01552 
01553         if (!curImpli->wire->modified)
01554         {
01555 
01556                 // now it's modified
01557                 curImpli->wire->modified = true;
01558 
01559                 // Save the old value of the wire
01560                 Value oldValue = (curImpli->wire)->value;
01561 
01562                 // create a new implication
01563                 Implication *newImpli = new Implication(curImpli->wire, oldValue, curImpli->direction);
01564 
01565                 // push the new intention
01566                 Logs.push_back(newImpli);
01567 
01568         }
01569         // change the curr value
01570         (curImpli->wire)->value = curImpli->value;
01571 
01572 
01573         return true;
01574 }

01581     {
01582         cout << "Couldn't open the file tests/randvectors.txt" << endl;
01583         exit(-1);
01584     }
01585 
01586     // set the random seed for random vector generation
01587     srand(time(NULL));

01594 
01595 void Generate_Full_FaultSet()
01596 {
01597     faultWriteFile.open("tests/faults.txt",ios::out);
01598     if (!faultWriteFile.good())
01599     {
01600         cout << "Couldn't open the file tests/faults.txt" << endl;
01601         exit(-1);
01602     }
01603 
01604     map<string,Wire *>::iterator iter= circuit.Netlist.begin();
01605     string DFault =  " 0";
01606     string DBarFault  = " 1";
01607 
01608     for (; iter != circuit.Netlist.end(); iter++)
01609     {
01610         faultWriteFile << iter->second->id << DFault << endl; 
01611         faultWriteFile << iter->second->id << DBarFault << endl; 
01612     }
01613     faultWriteFile.close();
01614     return;

01617 
01618 void RandomVectorTest::GenerateAndSetRVector()
01619 {
01620     map<string,Wire *>::iterator iter;
01621     int randLen = sizeof(int)*8;
01622     int randNo = rand();
01623     int curPos = 0;
01624     for (iter = circuit.PriInputs.begin(); iter != circuit.PriInputs.end(); iter++)
01625     {
01626         bool bit = ( (randNo & (1 << curPos)) >> curPos);
01627         randomVectorFile << bit;
01628         (iter->second)->value = (Value)(bit*0xf);
01629         curPos++;
01630         if (curPos == randLen)
01631             curPos = 0;
01632     }
01633     randomVectorFile << endl;
01634 
01635     return;
01636 }

01708 
01709 
01710 TestSet ATPG::PerformTest(Circuit& circuit, FaultSet set)
01711 {
01712     TestSet resultset;
01713     TestVector tempvector;
01714     // Run ATPG on the fault set
01715     MAIN_DFILE << "size of the fault set = " << set.size() << endl;
01716     int detectedFaults=0;
01717     int undetectedFaults=0;
01718     list<Fault>::iterator it = set.begin();
01719     for (; it != set.end(); it++)
01720     {
01721         // Important to clean up stuff from the previous run before we begin
01722         // Set all wires to U
01723         Clear_Wire_Values(circuit);
01724         // No Implications or logs should be there.    
01725         while (!ImpliQueue.empty())
01726             ImpliQueue.pop();
01727         Logs.clear();
01728         // Clear all the Frontiers.
01729         circuit.DFrontier.clear();
01730         circuit.JFrontier.clear();
01731 
01732 
01733         bool result = Do_ATPG(it->FaultSite,(it->faultType == 0) ? D : DBAR);
01734         if (result) 
01735         {
01736             tempvector.clear();
01737             MAIN_DFILE  << "Ran D algo SUCCESSFULLY for wire  " << it->FaultSite->id << " for the fault s-a-" << it->faultType << endl;
01738             MAIN_DFILE << "Outputs at which fault is detected" << endl;
01739 
01740             detectedFaults++;
01741             // Iterate through list of POs to see if which of them has 
01742             // D or DBAR.   
01743             map<string,Wire*>::iterator iter = (circuit.PriOutputs).begin();
01744             for (; iter!=(circuit.PriOutputs).end();iter++)
01745             {
01746                 if (iter->second->value == D ||  iter->second->value == DBAR )
01747                     MAIN_DFILE << iter->second->id << "   " <<  iter->second->value
01748                         << endl;
01749             }
01750             MAIN_DFILE << "Emitting the test vectors" << endl;
01751             for (iter=circuit.PriInputs.begin(); iter!=(circuit.PriInputs).end();iter++)
01752             {
01753                 tempvector.push_back(iter->second->value);
01754                 switch (iter->second->value)
01755                 {
01756 
01757 
01758                     case ZERO:
01759                         MAIN_DFILE << "0";
01760                         break;
01761                     case ONE:
01762                         MAIN_DFILE << "1";
01763                         break;
01764                     case U:
01765                         MAIN_DFILE << "U";
01766                         break;
01767                     case D:
01768                         MAIN_DFILE << "D";
01769                         break;
01770                     case DBAR:
01771                         MAIN_DFILE << "DBAR";
01772                         break;
01773 
01774                 }
01775 
01776                 MAIN_DFILE << " ";
01777 
01778             }
01779             
01780             resultset.push_back(tempvector);
01781             MAIN_DFILE << endl << endl;
01782 
01783 
01784             // Open the debug file afresh.
01785             // We dont need debug info for runs that were
01786             // successful.
01787             ATPG_DFILE.close();
01788             ATPG_DFILE.open("debug/atpg.debug",ios::out);
01789         }
01790         else
01791         {
01792             cout  << "Ran D algo but failed for wire  " << it->FaultSite->id << " for the fault s-a-" << it->faultType <<  "  and the result is  " << result << endl;
01793             cout << " FAULT NOT DETECTABLE " << endl;
01794             undetectedFaults++;
01795             //Prints stats so far before exiting
01796             // MAIN_DFILE << "Faults detected so far "  <<  detectedFaults << endl;
01797             //MAIN_DFILE << "DEBUG ME NOW. I am exiting" << endl;
01798             //cout << "I am " <<  it->FaultSite->id<< " DEBUG ME NOW. I am exiting" << endl;
01799             //exit(0);
01800 
01801         }   
01802         MAIN_DFILE << endl << endl;
01803 
01804     }
01805 
01806     MAIN_DFILE << "Total Faults detected :        " << detectedFaults << endl;  
01807     MAIN_DFILE << "Total Faults not detected :    " << undetectedFaults << endl;  
01808     MAIN_DFILE << "Total number of wires:         " << circuit.Netlist.size()<< endl;
01809 
01810     return resultset;
01811 }
